comment: One may ask why White is playing on. Perhaps Mieses had in mind the game Teichman-Burn, Osten 1905, in which Teichmann was virtually presented with the Exchange, yet lost in the end by dilatory play - assuming that game would win itself (he must have forgotten Tarrasch's dictum that there is nothing so hard to win as a won game)
reasoning: The comment offers a plausible explanation for the mistake, suggesting a strategic consideration based on a specific game and a key chess principle.
